intro: Matayba inelegans, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or *Eugenia uniflora*, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible red berries resembling cherries. These berries are rich in vitamin C and are used in local cuisines and traditional medicine. Matayba inelegans thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
